item.title: March 13 2024 Update
item.description: Bluetooth connectivity tested. We are now able to successfully control motor on arm to spin the disc. <video src=“ https://tookray.github.io/fydp-website/logs/videos/disc-spin.mov" type=“video/mp4” controls

item.title: March 1 2024 Update
item.description: Electrical Team Electrical system assembly is underway, main PCB arrived and is being assembled. Mechanical Team Main mechanical assembly is complete, only missing safety panels and legs.

item.title: February 9 Update
item.description: Mechanical update During the week, plywood frame was assembled. Shaft still needs to added and fit. Gripper assembly completed with latch release test completed.

item.title: January 2024 Update
item.description: Week 1 to 2 Batteries, motors and electronics delivered and initial testing/setup initiated. Mechanical components arrived, we quickly got to work machining shaft and small gripper components to get a head start on assembly.

item.title: Gripper Prototype 3 and Case Design
item.description: Gripper Prototype 3 The last disc gripper prototype was modified with some PCV bushings on the side, it turned out that with the top bearing this was enough to constrain the discs motion.

item.title: PCB Design
item.description: Schematic mostly completed for custom PCB designed for DC-DC converter to step down 48 V to 24 V and 12 V.

item.title: Shaft Design, Gripper Prototype 2, and MCU Selection
item.description: Shaft Design nad Gripper Prototype First draft of the main arm system and shaft completed. Materials picked (Aluminum 6061) and hand calculations done on the shaft and bearings.

item.title: Electrical Architecture
item.description: Electrical architecture overview created. Battery requirements are based on the largest motor’s electrical ratings. E-stop added for hardware safety.

item.title: Gripper Prototype 1 and MCU Requirements
item.description: Disk Gripper Prototype A prototype disc gripping design was created. It was a failure as it did not constrain the disc enough and it kept falling to the side.

item.title: Electrical Part Selection
item.description: Primary Motor, Motor Controller and Battery options investigated. Current option involves a 48 V Brushless DC motor rated at 4000 rpm speed with 0.

item.title: Overall Project Timeline
item.description: Based on tight timelines and constrained team schedules, the following time line was set up based on the team’s availability and prioritisation of tasks.
